title: Brain, Behavior, and Evolution
description: This course provides a survey of natural behaviors, including birdsong, prey capture, localization, electroreception and echolocation, and the neural system that controls them, emphasizing broad fundamental relationships between brain and behavior across species. Cross-listed with BIPN 189. Students may not receive credit for PSYC 189 and BIPN 189. Prerequisites: upper-division standing, BILD 2 or COGS 101A or COGS 107B or PSYC 102 or PSYC 106.
